name: Generating counts
description: A counts matrix is generated by cellranger count V7.0, which also filters the counts matrix. See the cellranger-generated web summary for metrics outputted by that tool.

name: Filtering ambient mRNA
description: Ambient RNA can contaminate droplets with non-cellular RNA. Using SoupX, these contaminant RNA molecules are accounted for and removed computationally. The filtered matrix generated by this tool is analagous to the one generated by cellranger count, so both filtered matrices will get the same treatment to generate final outputs.

name: Counting spliced/unspliced RNA
description: Using velocyto run10x, RNA molecules are categorized as spliced, unspliced, or ambiguously spliced. velocyto stores this information as a .loom file with 3 layers, which will be combined with each of the matrices generated in steps 1 and 2.

name: Combining filtered matrices with velocyto's output
description: Add velocyto's output as layers to each of the filtered matrices using scanpy.

name: Annotating data
description: Using scanpy, mitochondrial, ribosomal, sex-linked, hemoglobin, cell-cycle, and stress-response genes are all annotated. See the gene annotation strategy for more information. Additionally, cells are identified as potential doublets with scrublet. Converting to Seurat-readable files,From the .h5ad files generated in the prior steps
column3: construct a directory of files that Seurat can read and save as .h5seurat files. Method adapted from this notebook."
